verses.text: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? Whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, To feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
I \add am\add* my belovedâ€™s, and my beloved \add is\add* mine: He feedeth among the lilies.
Thou \add art\add* beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, Comely as Jerusalem, Terrible as \add an army\add* with banners.
Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: Thy hair \add is\add* as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
Thy teeth \add are\add* as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, Whereof every one beareth twins, and \add there is\add* not one barren among them.
As a piece of a pomegranate \add are\add* thy temples within thy locks.
There \add are\add* threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, And virgins without number.

My dove, my undefiled \add is but\add* one; She \add is\add* the \add only\add* one of her mother, She \add is\add* the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; \add Yea\add*, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
Who \add is\add* she that looketh forth as the morning, Fair as the moon, clear as the sun, \add And\add* terrible as \add an army\add* with banners?
I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, \add And\add* to see whether the vine flourished, \add and\add* the pomegranates budded.
Or ever I was aware, My soul made me \add like\add* the chariots of Ammi-nadib.
Return, return, O Shulamite; Return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
